YlMEtDp-W582r_jcIN_ITg.text: i would go back just because they have sweet potatoe fries and i'm in love with sweet potatoes fries. went here tonight on my way home. ordered a cheese burger (5 pounds) and sweet potatoes fries (3 pounds). i liked that they had a turkey burger option, though i opted for the beef. plus point for adding nothing to the burger so you can sauce it up as you like. also pretty good service. they have milkshakes as well if you are looking for that sort of thing and seemed to have lots of veggie options for a burger place. i would definitely go back if i was craving a burger and fries. only complaint is that the burger was a little burnt, but since this place seems new, i'm sure they'll learn.

qRFcmNCDAZ4DmYB0Ux_paQ.text: I happened to walk past Guerilla Burgers over the weekend shortly before lunch-time, so when the time came to decide where to eat, this was a no-brainer. What drew me to this place - besides the general hype all over the (paper and online) media - was the decor. I liked the drawings and colourful interior. (Why yes, I do judge a book by its cover. Why do you ask?) I opted for a Topless Burger Salad in a futile attempt to be healthy. For those who haven't been there, it's a salad with coucous and a burger patty on top. I don't think the burger was wonderful as they were a little on the dry side in spite of being medium rare. My friend opted for the Rodeo Burger. The bacon which topped the burger was amazing. Thick, and crispy. The best bacon I've ever eaten. Seriously. If they had a bacon sandwich/butty option, I'd probably go for that over the burger next time. We shared a serving of Smothered Fries. Based on the description (fries 'smothered' with cheddar cheese and veggie chilli), it sounded like a good bet, but I'd say it was average at best. I've had better chilli-smothered nachos served at bowling alleys, to be honest. So, if the fries weren't too great and the burger wasn't spectacular, why exactly am I giving this place four stars? Because of the service! The service was impeccable. The lady who showed us to our seats, and our waiter, Eric, were cheerful and perky beyond belief. It was such a refreshing change to receive such good - dare I say - American-style service. It made me happy on a day I had started off feeling a little like crap. And I'll take that over incredible food any day!

mYwWvm-9mKHfnwDwuLBg5A.text: I don't ask for much with my burger - just a nicely cooked burger with some extra trimmings in a nicely decorated place. And on that score, Guerilla Burgers delivers. Maybe it was the summer sunshine, but the place definitely had a relaxed and cool vibe about it that reminded me of Cuban summers - not that I've ever been to Cuba. The waitress asked us how we liked our burgers - my medium burger turned out to have more pink in it than I would normally associate with a medium burger, but I was fine with that. Some people may not be. Also, if you like 'British' bacon with your burger, don't come here. The bacon was cooked American-stylee - ie fried to a dry lifeless flaky piece of meat. Terrible. My other main criticism with this (and other 'posh' burger joints) is the pricing - charging £7 for a burger, and then £3 for an additional portion of fries just seems ridiculous. But I seem to be alone in this. then again, maybe it's a small price to pay for a truly relaxing place to hang out in.

wxaV8KOvMZ4DdWZ6UAQLfg.text: When I get a craving, I would walk over hot coals for a decent burger. But finding a decent burger that doesn't cost the earth? Nigh on impossible. Here's a clue: It's not at GBK. but the burgers at Guerilla are a pretty good place to start. Like most burger joints I've been to, everything else other than the burger is just window dressing. Starters a bit pointless, sides very run of the mill. Actually, neither were bad. The burger was good, although I should have asked for medium rare, as is often the case, the burger wasn't nearly as pink as I'd have liked. Even the crinkle cut chips weren't bad, and I hate crinkle cut chips (no, I don't know why). Things I liked? The service was excellent. Really excellent. The cocktails were good too. Things I didn't like? My pickle wasn't sliced and wouldn't go in my burger. And the rose wine is pretty awful. The sugary Ribena-esque stuff that I avoid like the plague. But dinner for under a tenner in Marylebone is a rare thing. My hunt for the perfect burger isn't over, but I'd be more than happy to come back here.

DGlKXQQWeEMTabs5pPoTkg.text: There isn't too much I can add to Grants brilliant review, but I still wanted to write a review as I had a brilliant time at burger and cocktails, I didn't have a burger but I sure had cocktails. I am always a fan of hard shakes and this place offers them and at a reasonable price-what's not to love?? I tried a couple of varieties, both excellent, and there was loads of tasty comfort food options on the menu, which I would definitely have enjoyed had I not over indulged earlier in the day. The service was what really set burgers and cocktails apart, obviously it sometimes takes just one person having a good or bad day to affect the service you receive however here not only did our waitress genuinely seem to take pleasure in taking our orders and bringing us food, but also all other staff that I interacted with seemed to share the joy. I saw nothing to suggest this isn't the usual way things are around here and for this reason I am sure I will be back when I need somewhere relaxed to have some naughty snacks and shakes, especially the next time I have visitors from abroad who want to eat somewhere central without the usual central prices

Uzx-6n1zx0tQFXV-cR1SCA.text: I'm in two columns: one the one hand the sunny weather and the ravenous appetite falsify my critics... The burgers (vegetarian, two choices: vegetables or goat cheese) were ok. I've eaten better ones with a diverse range of tastes - Guerilla veggie burgers seem to be quite boring in comparison.The wishy-washy fries and the oil-soaked onion rings didn't help.All in all for its only average taste way to expensive! Spending 25 quids for two person's lunch is ridiculous! But, however, nice located with friendly and fast service. A star for that.May the interior seems to be a little impersonal with its CI feeling like in a nursery school...

ajkssGlB9nLhTl73vigA8g.text: As 'dedicated' burger restaurants go, Guerilla Burgers seems a bit more laid-back and scaled-down than most others. This is no bad thing -- who says you need to get all sniffy to enjoy a well-made burger? The decor and atmosphere is deliberately 'revolutionary' -- I'm not sure why, but I don't see why not either. It gives the place a bit of a buzz, but an unpretentious one. Our excellent waitress matched this perfectly, always smiling and rarely standing still. The food was not spectacular, but decent enough nonetheless. My burger was satisfyingly put together, with a medium-cooked beef patty and decent bacon, cheese, lettuce and tomato in an interesting but hardy toasted bun. It wasn't huge, but it wasn't expensive either -- you definitely get what you pay for. An accompaniment of crinkly chips was excellently retro, if somewhat unauthentic. The appetisers were OK (if somewhat forgettable), but the shared puddings of chocolaty stuff (I wasn't really paying attention by this point) were pretty good. We left rather stuffed. There was one small hiccup at the end of our visit, where we were charged for several side-orders that we had not received. However this was quickly resolved. All in all, I would recommend Guerilla Burgers for those looking for a well-executed but unpretentious burger.

NjawOA_Rr6-e8ssci_pVCA.text: Having not yet been to Byron to compare I can only review this place based on the night I had with a bunch of other Qypers as part of the Meat Up event this week. So, where to start - Location is OK if you want to torture yourself by shopping on Oxford Street I guess, it's certainly pretty central. The "Revolution" theme - "Power to the Patty" and all that, makes for a fun environment, but it's hardly something to take seriously - I always find these appropriations forced to the limit - what is so revolutionary about a burger? Anyhow, I liked the vibe of the place, our waitress was a ball of energy (in a good way) and kept our margaritas topped up and was always smiling. She was bopping along to the music as I came back from the bathroom and confessed that I had been dancing under the hand dryer to the previous song. 2 minutes later she came over and had put the same song on again - that is service right there..! Personally I didn't think the music was too loud, it was certainly noticeable but this isn't a fine dining experience. The food was also enjoyable, I liked the tarragon dip with the chicken nuggets and the nachos were ok. I had the Cobb burger, with blue cheese, bacon and avocado and it was very tasty - cooked well enough to be juicy and in a nice brown bun. The sweet potato fries were a winner for me, but I'm a sweet potato freak so it would be hard to destroy them. I'm not sure about the metal bowl things the burgers were served in but it didn't really detract from the experience. I didn't think I could manage dessert either but the creamy Oreo cookie thing and the brownie were both devoured quite quickly in the end, proving the theory that regardless how much meat you eat, you can still manage some chocolate. I enjoyed it, it is a fun place for a very reasonably priced meal. Thanks to Alex for organising it!

TJRMRKjCX1DXkYucE3FLlw.text: Here's the problem with burger joints outside of the US who try to do US style; just as dumping red sauce on thin noodles does not make Italian cuisine, so bright decor and burgers do not make American yums. The location is nice, a good corner spot with plenty of natural light and breeze. However, I couldn't blame not hearing my fellow guests on the traffiic outside, but on the exceedingly loud music inside - annoyningly loud tunes drowned out conversation. We tried 2 starters and burger apiece. The chicken nuggets were serviceable, with a nice Russian tarragon sauce, but as an ex-pat who grew up on nachos, FOR THE LOVE OF GOD DO NOT MAKE NACHOS IF YOU ARE NOT SURE HOW TO MAKE THEM. Our bowl of strange chips with baked on cheese and 'sour cream' (I'm sorry, I will never get used to your sour cream) and guac was painful at best. My cobb burger was well put together, but as I got turkey it was exceedingly dry. I should have gotten beef, my partner seemed to like his. I will giive it an extra star for two things - the cookies and cream milkshake was fabulous, and our server was brilliant in keeping up with us. She definately added a star for me.

1fh7a91DVizWw_H1LnpzOg.text: I went along on day one of Guerilla Burgers' opening. The decor and humour on the walls and on the menu made me smile. From the graphic on the awning to the 'apps' section of the menu (appetizers did exist before the iPhone you know). Everything was spot on, the service was incredibly good and I felt happy in there, which considering moaning is my natural default is pretty darn good. The chilli bowl and chips was a winter warming alternative to minestrone soup with the quality to out-do tex-mex establishments. The cookies n' cream milkshake was a risk as I don't actually like real cream. The gamble paid off, because it was excellent. This excellence also applies to the fish tacos which waves the flag for the London fresh-mex style scene doing the rounds. The only slight disappointment came ironically from the burgers. My veggie mate said his veggie burger looks great but wasn't quite there with the spiciness or taste. However, it's not enough for me to knock off a star from my experience as his plate was spotless. As I got the bill a business card sticker arrived: a suggestion to stick it somewhere in a guerilla marketing tactic. markstone.posterous.com/…  However, in the guerilla warfare that is the posh burger battle of London, I'm sure Che Guevara would pop by here for refuelling if he finds himself in the area...

xN6puWv4GEAnKWto1JgTcg.text: Hey. I liked it ... a lot. Certainly not the best-est of the best in terms of London burgers but still very good. I'd be glad to go back. On my visit (londonist.com/2010/03/ne…) , I had the Cheddar BLT burger. It was juicy and well garnished. I'd probably have a go at it again. The sweet potato fries were pretty decent too. The foodie contingent of social media folk seem to be particularly underwhelmed with Guerilla Burgers. Maybe there was just too my hype about this place? Whatever the case, I don't see what all the negative hubbub is about. No, this will not be the greatest culinary experience of your life. But GB offers up some great burgers - something not that common here in London.

ne8g2ZtsRowHtSR1HIZw1A.text: Oh dear. We're not off to a good start. Guerilla Burgers opened this week, and we popped in for an evening burger on their second night. You can still smell the paint on the walls and it's nestled on James St where Tootsie's used to be: a culinary black hole of touristic medicocrity. So keeping its youth, inexperience and location in mind, let's see how they did. Despite a friend being able to order a medium/rare burger earlier in the day (and enjoying it too), I was denied the same patty treatment and proffered the 'health and safety' excuse. Irritating. Of course when they did show up (roughly 25 minutes later), they were hideously, unforgivably overcooked. Literally crunchy on the outside of the patty. Arid in texture despite pouring all the sauce I had to hand. This is a heinous crime when your raison d'etre is making burgers, and a hefty proportion of your overlong menu is given over to a poorly written quasi-diatribe on what makes 'the perfect burger'. PS: it's not burning it. The burger itself is served in a metal dish (the kind you would typically get a curry served in) with the condiments on the side. The buns were neatly toasted, but my companion simply stated through dried-out lips "I could have cleaned my bath with that burger". It doesn't stop there, they serve up crinkle cut chips. Like the ones out of the freezer you used to get round your best mate's house when you were nine years old. And they haven't changed. The fish tacos are also a country mile away from what fish tacos should be. They're marinaded salmon, with no coating and shop-bought tzatziki in there too. And were cold. There are some enormous menu issues going on here. It's too long and unfocused and the copywriter needs to start again. Check out the PDF on the site and witness the layout issues and bizarre menu choices (the LA burger has cottage cheese in it, burger sauce is called 'Russian Tarragon Dressing', sliders are called skaters for some incomprehensible reason, I could go on). Saving graces? Well the staff were very much full of first-week perk, which would have made us feel guilty about complaining about the food. They were trying really hard, and I can't blame them for what came out of the kitchen, although arguably a quality control process should be implemented to stop overcooked meat going out. If they sort out the menu and do some proper testing I might give it another go, but when you've got Byron within schlepping distance, then I can't think of a good reason to go here. The thing is, it won't really matter if the food doesn't get any better. James Street serves the post-Selfridges tourist crowd, and it will make no difference to them if whingy blogger types like me continue to opine Byron's simple genius over Guerilla Burgers.

o_6G_kXJm6PV-MCo7Yn0Ng.text: I normally avoid these burger joints - but today I really fancied one so called in here. I was impressed - good quality burger, good choice of add-ons, not too expensive, and very good service - fast, accurate, very pleasant and professional. Will definitely be the place of choice next time I am in the Oxford St area and have a need for a burger fix - particularly with blue cheese, bacon and avocade. YUMMMEEEEEEE!!

TfLC4zgF46UZEbR5sg7Q2Q.text: Very good veggie burger and probably the best onion rings I've ever tasted! All came with fresh salad, good bread and nothing was too much trouble. Great coffee too. This is hangover/comfort food done well, at a really good price. We didn't have to wait too long and the staff were very friendly. The Canadian waiter guy we had, had a really good beard too. I recommend.

cOKWKm6YOP9mBAYEO_YWtw.text: one of the most delicious burgers i ever ate. the chili burger is the bomb. not too spicy. try the sweet potato fries  are they worth it? definitely! friendly service in cool, fresh ambiance. i would like come back to london just for these burgers!

AARMMdlqLvm88S4L891Vjw.text: We decided to have an early dinner here today as the menu was simple and looked interesting. I had the American, my friends had the BLT, Cobb and the New Yorico hot dog. We also added side orders of sweet potato fries and smothered fries. You get complimentary tap water in a jug, and a tray of condiments - ketchup, mustard, mayo, tabasco, chilli flakes, salt, and pepper.The burgers came with a small metal cup of relish (similar to the ones they use at Friday's for the JD sauce for the steaks) and half a gherkin on the side. The burgers are in between a GBK and McD's. The menu says they are done medium, and should be a little pink on the inside. However, because the patties aren't very thick, they were almost completely well done, with just the tiniest hint of pink. Nevertheless, they were still juicy enough to be tasty. The buns were nice and crusty on the outside, soft on the inside, and they were seeded. I couldn't really taste the bacon in the burger, but I enjoyed the patty, cheese and mushrooms, with freshly cut onions and lettuce, along with healthy lashings of tabasco sauce. I also cut the gherkin up into chunks and added them to the burger.The smothered fries were disappointing, as the fries weren't very crispy, and the cheese had congealed and the vegetarian chilli had clung to it instead of seeping into the fries. The sweet potato fries, on the other hand, were delicious. They were sweet and crispy and I thoroughly enjoyed them.The meal for 4 of us, 3 burgers, a hot dog, 2 sides, and 4 drinks, came up to £45, which I felt was reasonable. Worth going to if you're in the area and want a reasonably quick and reasonably priced meal.

_fU3I5dGIpE-pdJDq2mVkA.text: I'm in love...with Guerilla Burgers' Rocky Road Milkshake.  Yum!  Hands down the best burger place I've found in London.  The service was a little slow (but it was a very busy lunchtime and there were six of us and we didn't book) but when the waiter did drop by he was brilliant and added to the fun.  Great atmosphere, fantastic burgers and a whole load of fun.  The chips were pretty darn good too.  I believe the restaurant is owned by the same people who own Giraffe but it's better becasue there are less kids.  Winner!

Yjden2M75Te1lvaphfXytw.text: Guerilla Burgers is a really good burger joint and would be the perfect pitstop to refuel during gruelling shopping trips (if you're insane enough to shop on Oxford street...) It has a nice laid back atmosphere, the staff are friendly and the service is quick. The burgers are huge and good (though I have to say the burger patties themselves are not remarkable, the green chilli chutney that came on mine was delicious) Then there's the sweet potato fries, which are a good enough reason to go there in the first place! why don't more places do them? After having had my arm twisted into having desert (I was so full I didn't think I could manage even a mouthful - turns out I could...) I can also recommend the chocolate brownie.

y6qCGRqyxtT6_xMiClfQ8g.text: had an opportunity to try out their tasty fries and skater burgers on their private party night..i was very impressed with the food altho the burgers were abit too dry. but to make up for it the vanilla milkshake was outstanding, so was the oreo chocolate shake!why is that the oreo biscuits doesn't taste as half decent as the milkshake?i did however thought the decor and layout could had done with abit more work. prices on menu wasn't even too dear!i can't wait to go back here for another round.not exactly a junk foodie but this has converted me back!

photos.caption: Photo of Burgers & Cocktails by Giraffe - London, United Kingdom

rqZq-bysjq39S3iSxIiAEA.text: I can't think of a thing to complain about. We ate here on our little trip to London this weekend. The location was adorable. We sat outside and just watching the people walk by, got the feeling that we were eating where the locals go on their lunch break. Our server was super friendly and got everything right! The two veggie burgers we ordered (Veggie garden bliss and the aubergine-goat's cheese burgers) were just delicious. Yummy crinkly fries too. Wish we'd ordered the sweet potato fries as well! We liked these burgers better than GBK, especially since their bread was fresh! I would go here a lot if I lived in London.

j0fty6Csh3cEp4705zxPwA.text: Not a fan I'm afraid. Good sweet potato chips, but otherwise quite blah. We went on the opening night so may be better with full menu variety and having been open for a couple of months, but I wasn't impressed. Really good service, however.

-bSMcsNoPuTrFMNNLCAdpw.text: This place is really nice and friendly, I loved it! From the moment I stepped in I was skeptical, as I've heard mixed things, plus it's changed hands a few times. Be it the case, this place, amazeballs! I Had the cookies and cream shake, first sip, I was in heaven, so damn tasty! I also had the ranch BBQ Burger (I think it was called), that was really really good! I thought this place was nice and very very friendly service. Whenever my brother is around this area, this is our new lunch stop.

photos.caption: Photo of Burgers & Cocktails by Giraffe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Burgers & Cocktails by Giraffe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Burgers & Cocktails by Giraffe - London, United Kingdom

nvhdN6c_EXzDTnJg0cDquA.text: I came here with the beautiful Mrs/Dr K a month ago after the other two places we intended to go to had 45min queues - I think not!!Mrs K had a veggie burger with a salted caramel milkshake which even she found hard to drink as it was crazy salty! Like, I needed tequila afterwards to cut the taste!My Ranch(?) burger was pretty good, and the boozy milkshake I had was awesome, least I think it was, as it was strong enough that I dont really remember. *facepalm*Service was good, and they didnt charge us for the salt solution, I mean, caramel milkshake.Would definitely come back herel.

jCQd2WLWbiLpj-ERlySLnQ.text: Enjoyable faux American diner affair with good shakes and good selection of burgers. Service was prompt, though left a little to be desired. The lack of conviction was reflected a little in the ambience and decor.The vegetarian burger though was magnificent though pass on the sweet potato fries which are a little tasteless and over done. Milk shakes were great, moreish and the Cookies and cream one had the perfect amount of Oreos. Great for groups or a chilled casual dinner.

rVwjSvdSyyH_jnNzwTONNA.text: The Hard Shake was disappointing - it wasn't thick like a milkshake but rather runny. Basically it was a mixed drink (Kahlua and milk) topped with half a cup of whipped cream. The fries were good, with a nice rosemary infused salt. I stopped in during a Saturday afternoon, so it wasn't super busy. The service was fine.

wvhDeVXvgh6y_w81KyI9uw.text: Heard mixed reviews and my companion for dinner didn't really want to go. However, how bad could it be? Byron is the benchmark in this space, and any burger place that serves a better burger is fine by me.We ordered Crinkly Fries, Onion Rings and the Matador and Sloppy Joe Burgers. The sides were average at best. Soggy onion rings and kebab shop fries. The burgers tasted ok, the Sloppy Joe being the tastiest. However they both looked pretty sad at best - like something that had potential while growing up but has been hugely neglected.I am not a burger snob, and in a pub (at pub prices) I would accept this. However, the difference between this meal and the Wetherspoon Burger Deal is just not enough.

jVbObC-TzEqLIHNFT01uCA.text: It's places like this that motivate me to work out every day. So I can eat.I've been craving for a burger for a few days. I walked pass Burgers & Cocktails after the gym thinking... well... why not. In the back of my head I was expecting a giant greasy burger that would put me into a food coma half way through and leave the rest of my saturday completely useless.BUT.When my food came I was pleasantly surprised. I ordered the Good Day Sunshine. For once the size of the burger was JUST RIGHT! I could pick up the entire burger and take a full bite with all the ingredients in it (unlike most places where I basically have to eat each layer of the burger on its own with fork and knife). The bun was light and freshly toasted, my sunny side up egg was slightly crispy on side the white and the yolk was just runny enough to coat the entire patty as I press down to pick up the burger. The bacon was perfectly crispy and the patty was juicy, fluffy and not over seasoned. I haven't been this satisfied with a burger for a long time. It was fresh and light as oppose to overly fatty and dense with overwhelming flavor that puts you in a deep coma. I would definitely go back for seconds and probably try their hot dogs and shakes next time!

kwMVRSvS6eHFrCh2gnGYkw.text: The restaurant had a good vibe, the staff were nice and friendly, but unfortunately, the food was nothing more than average. there are alot of great burger joints in  london e.g. patty and bun, and this just isnt quite the same standard.

zrgRj5d4ti2JRenUUfy4AA.text: I went for a meal here last Friday after work at around 19:30. There were six of us but only about 50% of the restaurant was full so we got a tabled straight away. The waitress herself didn't speak much English and didn't actually know what was on the menu and did not mention the specials at all (which we would have eaten if we had known).The food itself would be ok if it were pub food prices but when you're paying over £11 for burger and small portion of chips you expect more. They forgot part of my order so I had to ask for it again.If you really want a good burger and don't mind waiting outside for 30 minutes then just keep walking down the road to patty and bun. Much, much better.

tTMCy1bbaRWI63qPHudPCw.text: I like this place. The food is good, the staff is friendly and the service quick. It's on a lovely street for people watching as well. The one thing that I wish they did differently was chili. They do not have a proper chili burger. The three bean chili that they sell as a side tastes more like minestrone. Than is not a knock on the taste or quality. Both are fine. I just want a good greasy messy cheese burger. I have been here a couple of times and will continue to go back. This place is worth your money.

F9npXEZscYqQbE4fNr8TZg.text: Woah! Why you be hatin' on this place. Out of all of the large chains, like the GBKs and Byrons I have been too, Guerilla Burgers is pretty awesome. No it's not Bodean's but give these guys a break - they do sweet potato fries, how can you not love that?!The one thing that blew me away here was the service. Am I still in London? Because someone actually listened to what I orders, brought be extra pickles when I decided I wanted them last minute and was super polite. Since discovering meat I love a good burger and the burgers here are yummy. Their buns are tasty with teeny tiny seeds on them and they have a great selection of condiments. What more could you ask for... seriously? What more?

0I6CDO6UrT7tqr-uyQGNeA.text: Popped in for a swift cocktail before dinner. Service was good though I did get the feeling that just having a drink wasn't ok even tho it was early and it was quiet. I tried the coffee martini. Nothing to write home about. At the risk of sounding ancient, the music whilst fun northern soul, was far too loud for a conversation!

5GGAYlUqkwIvcVIi8JSygA.text: We had been walking around the cafes near Oxford Street when we happened upon this place.  We both had a craving for a burger and the menu here looked good.The problem was that we placed our order and it never came.  We became suspicious when all of the other tables around us were getting their food, and most of them had ordered after us.  The waiter realised that a mistake had been made, apologised and told us that the order would be another 2 minutes.  We waited, our order hadn't arrived, so we got up and left.It's too bad, because what everyone else was eating looked pretty good.  But when you are the unlucky one to have their order forgotten, it is not a good impression.

G2yXcKQxY_t36clcSb9GQw.text: This place must be pretty new, as I was hesitant to try it when we went a few weeks ago, as I couldn't find it on Yelp ;) I think it was good though! My hubby enjoyed his burger thoroughly and I liked the veggie patty also. The pricing on the salads to me was a lil awkward as they were more pricey than some burgers, and even more if you wanted to add a patty. All in all I liked the options - and would return. The salted caramel shake sounded fab but was actually waaaay too salty to drink (and this is for someone whose go-to drink is a salty lassi!) lol x

rTMUYhHkrhqx6gP2ti_9wA.text: Quiet cheap if you think of the location and comparing to other restaurants on James St for aroung 10 pounds pp. Love the one called Good Day Sunshine. Although the service is not like 100% nice I guess its good for things like burgers.

Hivn9XFYko5tY-WMJC8Hkg.text: I'm chillin'. Enjoying my blue cheese burger with salsa on the side. Grooving on the sweet potato fries. Kinda of delirious with the quick service. And then I think, "This place is kinda like Giraffe...but without the annoying as hell Putamayo, world music vibe and garish colours...and kids throwing crayons." Then a kid next to me chucked his menu on the floor and the very friend staff person confirmed that this is Giraffe's burger venture. I won't hold it against them 'cause it was delish. And if the staff want to work for pooled 10% tips, that's their business. I'll just ignore the forced cheekiness on the menu.

X63Ire2ffNlddaPM5nsTlA.text: I'm up and down about how to write for this place, I've been a smattering of times now, and I'll say that they've certainly picked up their game, because they got my order wrong the first two times that I went. Now you might ask why I'd bother going back if they were a tad on the lame service side? Because even though they were wrong, they were 'tasty wrong'. They also acknowledged their mistake when it happened, and remunerated accordingly. It's been my lunchtime oasis on a few occasions, so I'm pretty happy about its being around, and yes Ana H,.. the Sweet Potato fries are kickass. Hey Yelp, you need to implement a .5 scoring system, because I'm really dancing between a 3 and 4.

vKnUv4xYMgh1bidz6qSnkA.text: Was a last resort pick to satisfy a hamburger craving (see my review of Tommi's burger).  I believe this is part of a chain, but it wasn't bad.  My hotel was in Marleybone, which is kind of a wasteland for quick late night eats.  Walking over to oxford street gave me more options but there weren't all great.  This place kind of typifies that.. fast, casual, and a little bit touristy.

W9TAw2k_XtaG841bRo0flw.text: It's kinda funny that their credit card receipts still say Tootsies on it! This place is your average burger joint that fits snuggly between a Byron's and a McDonald's burger!! Worth a visit. PS Try their cherry mustard! Nice bunch of guys working there as well.

1M5RcplP6Y6yCc35lpU9hg.text: Hose me down, because I've been greased! This burger was hands down, the greasiest burger I've eaten in my life. I wasn't prepared for this level of grease. Think the kind of grease you get when you go to your local chippy at 3am for a drunken feed., the kind of grease you get in your local caff. Artery clogging grease. It was just wrong. Every time I lifted my burger up to my mouth, I had to make sure to avoid the grease that was dripping out of it. By the end (I only ate about half of it), there was a film of grease over the entire plate and the bottom half of the bun was sopping with it. Gross. It was a real shame but the service was top notch and the venue itself has been decorated in a really fun and quirky way.

-or_zj0OHzZ1mRIwic8p_Q.text: What a disappointment. The service was hectic even though there were very few guests. Our burgers were half dull and dry, but the worst was that the staff could barely get us out fast enough. The waiter took away my glass of cola before I had drunk out and then came with the bill before I asked for it. We come from Denmark and  are tourists in London and this place is what we would call a tourist trap!

-TJo5J5o9ZICX5sMW_QNJQ.text: 4.5-5 starsI have to give props to the staff and Burger & Cocktails. They were incredibly friendly and the service was fantastic! I was slightly hesitant at first after seeing the reviews but I sense that a vast improvement has been made. The waiter recommended the calimari as a starter which tasted great. For mains I had the cheese burger and sweet potatoes, my sister had the chicken schnitzel and chips. Both tasted delicious and we were both very satisfied. However, the price of the sweet potato fries was a far stretch given the portion but that didn't affect our experience. We also had dessert.. churros and ice cream! Yum! And we also got a hi five! Will definitely visit again :)

zRKk2638ezwZkq3_p2eSQQ.text: Came here for lunch during the week. Not busy at all - plenty of room to get a table.Typical faux-American diner. Funky bright interior, with Elvis playing. I ordered the Matador burger. I asked to swap out the cheese for a fried egg - but they said no. It's cool, was only 75p extra anyway. As you can see, burger piled super high. Great flavour. Though the bun could have been a little more "brioche" and a little less "floured bap". This is an American diner after all!Service was fast and polite - as you'd expect when they aren't busy.It didn't blow my socks off but it was a solid choice for lunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Burgers & Cocktails by Giraffe - London, United Kingdom. Matador burger (with an extra fried egg) - you need to eat this with a knife and fork

M1MvSzLqOQqywPWkAYPOdQ.text: Fun american diner style place that could accommodate a group of 10 at 9pm on a weekday night. We weren't fussy (having enjoyed two hours of happy hour nearby!) but we were turned away from the surprisingly small nando's over the road because they'd 'stopped cooking as much food after 9pm' (or some similarly ridiculous explanation).A couple of things let this place down for me. Firstly they didn't have any shakes, and the hard shakes on the menu sounded lush! The main thing though was the burger. I went for the special 'The French' burger with caramelised onion, blue cheese and pear, three very distinctive tasting ingredients. But it came out tasting of nothing at all. The cooked-past-my-liking patty I could handle, but it was as if the toppings had bizarrely cancelled each other out. If you're going to put 'Burgers' in your name, they'd better have a lot more flavour than this!The main thing that saved the experience though was the amazingly friendly service. Our large (loud) group was welcomed in an hour before closing (by a waiter with awesome dreads) and our waitress was just the right balance of chatty but efficient. They were fine with some of the tweaks my mates asked for and she remembered roughly who ordered what when the food came out - always a thoughtful touch.The fun, friendly service (and sweet potato fries!) means I'd probably come back if I was with a big group seeking sustenance again. The prices are also so reasonable for the central location that one of my mates was passed the card machine to pay for him and his wife, and had to check they were charging him for two people! Hopefully next time I'll get to try the shakes too...

14UycKRknCzXri051kFmqg.text: I wondered when I would have the best burger in U.K. I am sure there are better but this was fantastic. Twin that with great service. If u miss stuff like burgers and jalapeños this is the place

fSK5UU4iptFCmScGPcZPtw.text: This restaurant is nice decor and very nice staff, but unfortunately the food was mediocre.I had the L.A burger which has toppings such as cottage cheese, avocado, and the usual. It would've been really good but the meat was quite dry, not juicy at all and even tho the toppings were nice the bread was good but they couldn't cook the meat properly ):   I hd the sweet potato fries as well which weren't that hot and just didn't really taste that good.In conclusion I might come back and see if it was just a one time thing, but maybe not. For their prices I know other burger joints that have much better burgers.

photos.caption: Photo of Burgers & Cocktails by Giraffe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Burgers & Cocktails by Giraffe - London, United Kingdom. Menu
Photo of Burgers & Cocktails by Giraffe - London, United Kingdom. Cocktail menu

yUlqGCEAUTJVqRqPrTo6FA.text: Good food but the service was badThey was a little rude when they saw us Arab !!They keep asking for the next table if they need anything but when we ask for a drink they didnt come back with the drink And when we tried to talk anyone of them to being a napkin .. they acting like they don't see us as well

_8wRY39Zw0swpzW2EMpOxw.text: Have you ever been walking down a street without knowing where you're heading to ? last summer, i was in london with a friend and we were hungry as hell. we were walking down Oxford Street and we saw that long street with a lot of little restaurant so we turned that way and started looking for some place to stop by.And here we find : Giraffe Burgers & Cocktails. Doors were wide openned, music in the air and it felt like it was waiting for us to enter, sit and have a great meal. And What meal ! I rarely like Burgers, but when I find a great one, i appreciate it and so did I. Sure that my money was not waisted !WHAT I LOVEDthe atmosphere ! Everything seams to be done so you just feel like home somehow. Music is great, there is sound everywhere but not noise (in the restaurant, they can't control what happens in the street ^^) and there is that really joyful mood surrounding us ! Loved it !ANY CRITICS ?I'm no fan of very loud music, and even if I loved the music played that day I would have prefered it to be a bit lower, but that is just me and my ears ^^TO AVOID :Sit near the openned doors, the sound of the street mixed with music is not that great... plus some guys bothered us a bit while I was with my friend :( but that has nothing to do with the restaurant itself, it's just a tip ^^

GTSR4vK9qBcEfcvSbNe-8Q.text: I was surprised we managed to get a table for 7 on a Saturday night with no booking which for central London is amazing. As the name would suggest the place specialises in Burgers and Cocktails and it is part of the Giraffe group of restaurants.The food was good but it wasn't especially clear on the menu what actually came with the burgers, I really hate it when restaurants do that. By that stage of the day I was cocktailed out so only drank beer. Our server was also really helpful, attentive and flexible especially when we added a couple of stragglers to our table. I wouldn't go out of my way to come back but I will bear it in mind next time I'm in the area.

ae7K9g-7WxNi58zWpvFjAQ.text: lots of restaurants around here so it has a rather nice feel about the area. I was there during the week when the tourists who import their cars from dubai etc are around so i had a fabulous american burger gazing longingly at cars out of my price range lol.Hubby loved their peanut butter milkshake. We had the american which has bacon cheese onions and mushrooms on the burger. We paid for some sides which were a let down the chips didnt seem to be fresh but frozen crinkle chips and the onion ring was oozing oil and when you bit it the whole onion came out - very disappointing. The brownie dessert was very nice. If they could improve on the side dishes i reckon this would be a great place to eat.

photos.caption: Photo of Burgers & Cocktails by Giraffe - London, United Kingdom. American burger was very very tasty

K7usmCa8p5b7uJUE_H1I6A.text: Found this place by chance because they have lots of room, no waiting time (unlike some other burger restaurants nearby).Good selection of original burgers (personnally prefer the Sloppy Joe), good cocktails (though some are a bit too sweet) and milkshakes as well as hard shakes. I enjoyed the atmosphere and rock music the 3 times I've been there over the last couple of months.

8w6QSp0BfeI1ZwvWg-ExeQ.text: I was ravenous when I entered (breastfeeding a 1 month old) and ordered a regular burger and fries. There were plenty of tables when I entered (around 12pm) but completely filled with a line out the door when I left (around 12:45). The burger and fries were OK. Nothing special, but good enough to satisfy my burger craving that day. Wait staff were very nice.

photos.caption: Photo of Burgers & Cocktails by Giraffe - London, United Kingdom. My meal, basic burger and small fry
Photo of Burgers & Cocktails by Giraffe - London, United Kingdom. Inside
Photo of Burgers & Cocktails by Giraffe - London, United Kingdom. The inside of the restaurant

Sdu_CdMqMSfnCF9U5rK5yQ.text: From it's trendy decor to it's unique selection of reasonably priced burgers, Guerilla is a solid option for those wishing to upgrade from the run of the mill McDonalds and Burger King chains that line the streets of central London. Conveniently located around the corner from the Bond Street Tube Stop, Guerilla Burgers offers a wide selection of beef, turkey and vegetarian burgers that come with a variety of unique toppings ranging from Chili Peppers to Avocado. Complemented by their truly spectacular sweet potato fries, an outing at Guerilla makes for a good food option before exploring some of the nearby bar and club options. While it's relatively easy to be in and out without dropping much more than a tener, portions are a bit on the small side, so be sure to order large orders of sides. For those not wanting a burger, salads are quite large and worth the cost. Overall, Guerilla is a good non-chain burger option that's affordably priced, and the atmosphere makes for a good evening.

photos.caption: Photo of Burgers & Cocktails by Giraffe - London, United Kingdom. Green Chili Burger

XHMXQ0yt8caTr1gcHNKK-w.text: Fantastic! Fantastic food, fantastic staff, fantastic cocktails! We absolutely loved this place. Keep in mind that they play music in a very hear-able volume, which means that you should not go here if you are old and grumpy.For everybody else who is looking for a great time, go to burgers and cocktails! :D

photos.caption: Photo of Burgers & Cocktails by Giraffe - London, United Kingdom. A strong but good margarita.

T3C90_s2wlst8fnchG2rEg.text: Excellent service, very good food, large portions. Nice music and CLEAN bathrooms! (A rarity in this city).We sat outside in the sun enjoying this lunch. We'll for sure be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Burgers & Cocktails by Giraffe - London, United Kingdom

hgUf9OXsIHnfbOv3gGgXBA.text: Once upon a time I saw this place as I was walking toward Tommi's, and I thought that it sounded like an interesting name, but it would probably be a place I'd never go to as I couldn't imagine it would be good. Fast forward to a weekend when there were seven of us drinking heavily, and then deciding we needed a place for dinner. Seven? On a Saturday night in Central London with no booking? Good luck!Luckily, we were REALLY close to here, so we stopped in and asked how long of a wait it would be for seven people. They said, "Oh we have a table for you right now". Score. Unfortunately, everyone else was still at the bar drinking, but they held the table for us to run back and settle the bill and come back. So you gotta get a bonus star for a) having a table and b) holding it for us on a busy Saturday night.They have a nice cocktail selection, and they also provide boozy milkshakes. Luckily, they aren't the crappy British style milkshakes, but proper American milkshakes with ice cream. Add some booze and you're in heaven. I also had an espresso martini and it was incredibly tasty with fresh made espresso poured right in. You could definitely taste the coffee. Delicious!For food I had the green chili burger and split an order of Sloppy Joe fries and a mac and cheese wheel with the other half. The fries were great, and while they were in no shape or form covered with sloppy joe filling, they were some of the better chili fries I've had in London. The chili was full of flavor. The mac and cheese wheel was a deep fried mac and cheese served with marinara. American heaven. The burger was also much more tasty than I imagine for a place like this, and I had a bite of the chicken satay burger and was pleasantly impressed.All in all, this place exceeded all my expectations with surprisingly tasty food and really friendly service. I even managed to unknowingly do a magic trick when I made the menu disappear (by managing to drop it behind the booth seating against the wall as there is a tiny crack just big enough to slide a menu into. WHOOPS!)I don't know if I'll go out of the way to come back, but if we have a large group that needs some drunken sustenance and we're in the area, it's definitely a great place.

9B_03AZQiTq-4z03HHn8wA.text: Ok I admit it. I didn't want to come here.BUT my mobile decided to die as soon as I got out from the tube, so I didn't know where to find Patty&Bun and... Me and a friend fell back here. It seemed a nice place, relaxed atmosphere, beaches on the walls, a classic american diner with a caribbean setting. Good for going out with a friend, or even a group as the place is pretty big, don't go there for a first date UNLESS you know exactly what are you doing!How was it? Awesome! The staff is super-friendly and very relaxed, we ordered 2 burgers with fries as side and 2 beers (PS: they have red stripe! not easy to find around here!)..Now I have a very small, very important question: what's your problem with burgers, british people!?! Why for god sake are you giving me everything separated, I mean, I choose this burger among the others, therefore I DO want what it's written on, the fact that I have to compose it by myself seems so stupid!Anyway...Everything was good, not the absolute top quality I-want-to-cry-because-I-want-another-one but a pretty good burger indeed! Honorable mention to the onion rings: these things here are damn good! Kudos! The only drawback: I couldn't choose the cooking level of my meat... Uff... I will create a party, reach the parliament, become prime minister and I WILL CHANGE this thing.Every man should be able to decide their own cooking level!! Vive la Revolution!

3_S3l9GGZp-PpXeKBLb38w.text: After a last min bikini shop session in Primarni before jetting off to Lisbon Pride, the Mrs met me up this end and took me for a bit to eat. We're fans. I'm happy to report, for once, she chose wisely; good choice and good food. Not one to see a milkshake and deny herself, she orders the chocolate milkshake (described as 'yum') and I ordered the 'low carb beer'. - All satisfied. As always our eyes are bigger than our mouths and we order big fries, coleslaw and onion rings to go with our veggie burgers. The staff were very hairy as I recall, but friendly.It would defiantly be a place I'd return to, with friends.

photos.caption: Photo of Burgers & Cocktails by Giraffe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Burgers & Cocktails by Giraffe - London, United Kingdom. Mmmmmm

OjidTUNZwW3ZO9Pp1W7Umg.text: I had a great burger here for lunch... I also had the best cider of my life. If you like fruity drinks and a mild alcohol taste you will really like the ciders they offer.

photos.caption: Photo of Burgers & Cocktails by Giraffe - London, United Kingdom. Strawberry lime cider

8duCeM1g9wQpZX_znjT1tA.text: Do you smell a BBQ? Seriously... right now. Do you?No?Than why you gotta be up in my grill? Ahem. That now out of the way, Guerilla Burgers burger made me happy in a way that I can't quite explain. It wasn't mind-blowingly delicious, but sitting around a table with some of my favourite people in London, noshing on sweet potato fries and onion rings, sucking down our cokes over ice, passing pickles, sampling sauces... it just felt so comfortable. So normal. Like a backyard BBQ. And it tasted exactly like that too. Not stunning, just really really good, in a way that goes far beyond the food.There were some misses - notably the nachitos, the fish finger sando and the desserts (not deserts, to clarify). However the absolute must-order onion rings, sweet potato AND crinkle cut fries as well as the plain ol' beef cheeseburgers were spot on. I mean right on. As in, like, totally awesome, dude. Speaking of, like, totally awesome, the service was beyond stellar and our waiter was perhaps the friendliest, quickest, most efficient and just genuinely fantastic server I've had in London in a loooooong time. Longer even than I usually have to wait for my check. We didn't get his name, but Mr, Canada, we were all a-boat you.

ohEk8iOXOfoJZTwJFYs7Xg.text: One of the better casual burger joints in London. Guerilla burgers are fresh and cooked pink just as they should be. Location is handy in the heart of Marylebone. The atmosphere is more suitable for a child's birthday party than a classy night out, but let's be honest, you're here for the burgers and the sweet potato fries.Get the Rodeo Burger---BBQ Sauce, Crispy Bacon, Onion Rings---what's not to love!

photos.caption: Photo of Burgers & Cocktails by Giraffe - London, United Kingdom
